posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.44 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group .

Release notes:

  • Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

This beta release continues a new feature we’re ready to test: linked device history syncing! In short, we’re using an end-to-end encrypted, device-independent backup format to optionally sync message history to newly-linked devices. This is a feature we’re super excited to release and we know many of you have been waiting for. We released a test run of this feature for Android → Desktop linking before the holidays, and we’re now ready to open it up for iOS as well. (Please check out that forum post for more technical details and an FAQ!)

Specifically, with this beta you’ll be able to sync message history:

  1. From a primary iPhone to a special Desktop build you can download from the earlier forum post .
  2. From a primary iPhone or Android to an iPad.

NOTE: Testing this involves a new linking of the device. The special Desktop build can be installed side-by-side with your existing Desktops, but unfortunately due to technical limitations we can’t do the same on iPad; so, testing this requires deleting existing Signal data from your iPad (either via Settings → Account → Delete All Data or by reinstalling) and re-linking. Re-linking will restore your message history and last 30 days of media, but as this is a new feature, bugs may exist; please use appropriate caution before deciding to test.

If you decide to test, please post logs (and any issues you encounter either during or after the sync) here or on the original forum post ! They’re helpful both if there was an error and if it succeeded (so we can get a sense of things like performance).

Thank you, as always, for being beta testers. We couldn’t build these features without your help.

link_counts.title: Help us test desktop history syncing!
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.43 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.44.0.577-beta

42 new commits since 7.43.0.572-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.44 [1]

  • Fix format specifier [2]

  • Fix progress jumping in link'n'sync [3]

  • Add indeterminate progress to Link'n'Sync provisioning [4]

  • Add backup bencher to log more detailed processing time info [5]

  • Clear SplashBoard for new launch screen [6]

  • Remove Equatable & Hashable from KyberPreKeyRecord [7]

  • Clean up a few confusing messages [8]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.65.2 [9]

  • Remove unused constant [10]

  • Update backup proto with contact nicknames and 1:1 story replies [11]

  • Remove unused droppedMembers field [12]

  • Don’t inherit SSKBaseTest where it’s not necessary [13]

  • Include TSAttachments folder in device transfer [14]

  • Use joinFromInviteLink from change action when parsing group snapshots [15]

  • Include source progresses in OWSProgress [16]

  • Remove reduceLogChatter [17]

  • Don't count TSAttachment migration batch as failure if we never even try it [18]

  • Update copy for transfer-messages button [19]

  • Fuzz e164 author messages with non-matching recipient ids on export [20]

  • Remote config tsattachment migration delay [21]

  • Try the TSAttachment migration again after a week even if failed [22]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.3 [23]

  • Some subscription cleanup [24]

  • Migrate blocked groups to a dedicated table [25]

  • Fix typo in string [26]

  • Update secondary device syncing subtitle copy [27]

  • Sort blocked contacts/groups when displaying them [28]

  • Use the web socket where easily possible [29]

  • Make link preview backup error a warning [30]

  • Offer to contact support if Backup export fails during Link'n'Sync [31]

  • Disable group call tooltip after backup restore [32]

  • Offer to contact support if Backup restore fails during Link'n'Sync [33]

  • Add round-trip support for long-text attachments in 1:1 story replies from Backups [34]

  • Catch 404 errors fetching backup media tier auth credentials [35]

  • Change setWritingToolsBehavior calling structure to handle an Int param [36]

  • Add additional benching for Backups [37]

  • Show download progress in megabytes on linked device import [38]

  • Rotate the Link'n'Sync provisioning capability [39]

  • Ignore currently cancelling devices from device list [40]

  • Update release notes [41]

  • Update translations [42]

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: I’ve tried history sync but it doesn’t trigger the prompt on Android when trying to scan the iPad QR.

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked: Same for me. Linking iPhone to iPad works as usual, but nothing else is happening.

posts.name: Harry Sanabria
posts.cooked: Hi everyone! To test the linked device history syncing make sure both your iPhone and your iPad are running the latest beta release 7.44; it won’t work if either device has the version from the AppStore or a prior beta release (including 7.43 which had a prior iteration of this feature).

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Still not working for Android 7.30.2. Won’t get the prompt to link history on Android. When I try with Desktop AdHoc it works just fine but doesn’t work with the iPad on the latest TestFlight.

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.44.0/56a42747cee9944b2b47218228ee8aba6acaaf76135880bc646fd01f4e787632.zip

posts.name: Harry Sanabria
posts.cooked: Hi all, sorry about the late update but for now the new history syncing feature will only work for iPhone->iPad, with both on 7.44 versions. We’ll be re-enabling cross-platform history syncing soon (~in the next beta)

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked: Now that the file filter has been implemented in one of the latest versions, I thought it might be nice to be able to filter by links as well? Is something like that in the making?

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
iPhone and iPad on the latest testflight, but transfer crashed:

Filter: iOS Backup Export Failed
Hardware: iPhone
HID: 13,2
iOS Version: 18.0.1 (22A3370)
Signal Version: 7.44.0.577
Log URL: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.44.0/c0deac87f5eb078a2904b0c5a5963219b2b05dbf7fb9a31f5da06dfcf23a9f82.zip
Locale: en_DE

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
The tombstone for deleted messages on iOS iPhone is different than the intended tombstone that is used on iPad.

———————————————————————————————————

Quite surprised at how bad the quality was during a video call that was done on a pretty high bitrate?

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.44.0/f9150b4f8cdeb0ce9a9e04b7a7d95c6365af82310bf3077842edc084a5893be7.zip

A resolution of 240x96 for a bitrate of 6000 seems off

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked:
Question on this version or perhaps the desktop version. Could this synchronization also take into account where, say, the desktop version has older messages than the new iPhone would to synch from the Desktop version of the app to the iPhone version?

Use cases: 1: I’ve now moved from an Android phone to an iPhone or 2: for iPhones users who can’t do backups restores from their old devices to their newer ones, there is no way to bring older messages to the new iPhone. The desktop version of the app can span multiple phones and therefore have older messages that would be valuable to be able to synch to the new iPhone siince iPhone cannot do backup/restore like Signal on Android can.

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

A resolution of 240x96 for a bitrate of 6000 seems off

I had the same problem before, when video calling from iPad. Quality was very, very poor for me, while my partner had perfect video of me. Both our connections where fast and stable.

Will append log next time it happens.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: If you want to join backups use SignalBackupTools on github

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.45 release.
